results.title: It's up to us
results.brief_description: The Intellectual Disability Rights service have produced this video to help disabled people to deal with rights and responsibilities at work. It includes issues such as safety, sexual harrassment, the right to be treated fairly, the right to choose your own friends and to have relationships. The second section looks at why people may want a workers committee and how one group of workers set one up.
results.description: The Intellectual Disability Rights service have produced this video to help disabled people to deal with rights and responsibilities at work. The second section looks at why people may want a workers committee and how one group of workers set one up.

results.title: It's time to go
results.creator_credit: Cheryl Seymour, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: The Seymour family had struggled for years to keep the farm viable, despite rising interest rates, falling prices, droughts and fires. As the family got older and circumstances changed, it was time to make an important decision.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cheryl Seymour, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: It's the only body you've got
results.creator_credit: Paul Griffiths Presentations, National Heart Foundation of Australia and Roslyn Simms
results.brief_description: Deals with the relationship between diet and heart disease. Outlines the risk factors which contribute to coronary heart disease and advises on correct nutrition and diet to minimise these risks. Especially designed for secondary school students.

results.title: It's the little things that count
results.creator_credit: Caravel Films and Bates Manufacturing Company
results.brief_description: A motivational film presenting the problem of the retail salesman in reaching the buyer and gaining their confidence. Develops a technique in combatting the price argument by taking into consideration factors other thatn price only. Shows problems of the retail merchant in getting salesmen to conserve and plan their time. Illustrates with a number of articlea what is meant by ‘showmanship in selling’. Though not intended, this film presents an amusing stereotype of a 1940’s American saleman.

results.title: It's so nice to have a wolf around the house
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America and Paul Fierlinger
results.brief_description: An animated film, based on a book by Harry Allard which tells of an old man and his ageing pets, who decides to advertise for a companion to take care of them and pep them all up. A wolf named Cuthbert Q. Devine answers the call, turning their little houseboat into a happier place - but not without some adventures along the way.
